items.sentence: Sometimes you don\'t have to speak the same language to understand each other.
The only thing that mattered to Tom was that we weren\'t impolite to his boss.
Tom finally admitted to himself that he was never going to be able to do that.
Tom went to school even though his mother told him that he was too sick to go.
Tom found out that life on the road wasn\'t as easy as he thought it would be.
The crash at the intersection in front of the post office killed three people.
Tom talked to Mary\'s neighbors and asked them if they knew where she\'d gone.
Tom won\'t be able to do it by himself, so we need to ask someone to help him.
I know it\'s highly unlikely I\'ll be able to convince you that you\'re wrong.
I never for a moment imagined that I\'d be singled out for a full body search.
